creator: x2bmwill@southernco.com
text:
I have narrowed the problem down a little by coming up with a small
test. It seems to be an issue with using Tomcat 5.x (Tomcat 3.2.1
works) to sendRedirect() to a servlet that renders <application/pdf> contenttype
to IE 6.x (Mozilla works). I get a blank page that needs to be refreshed.
The fact that Tomcat 3.2.1 & 3.3a work makes me think it's a Tomcat bug. 

I attached my simple little test servlets (If I can figure out how).
There's a test.pdf file in the .jar that is used for the servlet output. Its 
location is hardcoded to c:\test.pdf in the TestPDFOutputServlet.

Created attachment 12259
Code,Classes,and PDF to reproduce the bug
creator: x2bmwill@southernco.com

text:
If Tomcat generates an invalid HTTP response (assuming you're not doing very
weird things in your servlet), we'll fix it.
creator: remm@apache.org
funkman@joedog.org
text: Worked fine with tomcat 5, 5.5 in mozilla and IE on winxp.
